intro: Lathyrus alefeldii, commonly known as the Alefeld's vetchling, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its botanical features include trifoliate leaves and stipules, which are common in the legume family. Lathyrus alefeldii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
